speaker: Archmage
lines: 'This will cost you your soul,' the archmage says.
'But you will be rewarded with the knowledge of the ages.'
He raises both of his hands lifting you off the ground, the weight of your soul pulling you down.
You feel your soul being ripped from your body, the pain is unbearable.
A green beam of what you can only guess is your soul, being pulled into the archmage's body.
You feel yourself weakening, your vision fading, your body going limp.
'This is the price of knowledge,' the archmage says.
His sinsiter laughter echoing through the room.
You feel yourself falling, falling into the abyss of knowledge.
You wake up with an overwhelming knowlege of all things consuming you.
Yet your body is weak, your mind is clouded, your soul is empty.
The archmage is standing in front of you, smiling.
'Welcome back child, this was the price of knowledge.'

choices.text: You leave the archmage's study with your new found knowledge.
